intro: Faramea correae, commonly known as the Brazilian holly or Brazilian evergreen, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Faramea correae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to different soil types. It thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
